intro: Sarcocephalus ramosus, commonly known as the African starfruit or wild starfruit, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its branched, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its fruit is a fleshy, star-shaped berry that turns from green to yellow or orange when mature. The plant is often found in rocky or wooded areas and is adapted to thrive in arid or semi-arid conditions.
